answers.answer: Have you had your gestational diabetes test done??

Sorry hit post to soon.If you have and all was okay I wouldn't be too concerned has an ultrasound can be off a pound give or take. It's not as accurate as you would think. How are you measuring at your appt's??

Could your due date be off? If you are further along that could account for it. Due dates are not a100% accurate guarantee. Unless it was via A.I.? It can sometimes be difficult to pin point. For example... my mother had three separate due dates for me. See if that could be possible.
Dont feel to bad i was 34+2 and they did an u/s and said my baby was already 6.2lbs and to think they were worried she would be small bc she has a 2 vessel cord i wouldn't worry too much

I really wouldn't worry,US can b way off in the later stages of pregnancy. Ive seen on here many times women being told they are having big babies n be induced at like 38 weeks only for the baby to be 6 or 7 lbs.Where I am from its not routine to offer US after 20 weeks due to this fact. When I got pregnant with my first i had a low BMI so I was given growth scans (to check baby wasnt small) at 28 n 34 weeks. Baby measured big on both but my dr was very dismissive. She said not only could the ultrasound be off but also babies grow at different rates n have growth spurts then slow down so even if my baby was big then doesn't mean she will be at birth. As it happened she was big, 9lb 6! But I had a natural birth n I'm tiny! Nothing I did or ate made her big,some women just have big babies. I'm now on my second n he feels like he could be even bigger! I'm not scared this time tho as I know my body will handle it fine.
My lil one weighed exactly 5lb 12oz @ 28 weks...he came out at 8lb 9.8oz!!! Nothing to worry bout
at my 34 week us my son was weighing 6lbs 4oz and dr said he will probly be 8-9lbs but i am having a c section at 39 weeks anyways so hes not worried

oh and i have been pretty healthy with this pregnancy, my dr told me dont try to prove me wrong and start eating a bunch of junk lol. I have been eating low fat everything and only sweets every few days to satisfy my cravings
They told me my last son would be a lot bigger than he actually was. The us was way off. They said about 7lbs. He came out weighing a little over 5 lbs.
With my first son they said he weighted 8.6 lbs but was born weighting 6 even. I learned to never trust the us scale lol. If baby looked good I wouldn't worry :)

Don't worry too much about it. When I went in at 32 weeks with my first, they told me he weighed 5.12 and was going to be a big baby. This concerned me because I was born weighing 9.2, and my cousins were all 10+ (no gestational diabetes, just big babies!)  My son was born at 39w6d weighing 6.12 and only 19 inches.
An ultrasound can be as much as 20% off on measurements so I honestly wouldn't worry too much. Besides your due date could be off by a week or two.
Thank you all so much!! Your comments made me feel soooo much better!!!!! :-)

question: I went for an US where I was told my little one weighs 5 lbs 12 oz when she is only supposed to be barely weighing 5 lbs. I am 34 weeks. Any one else have this problem?  Should I be worried that she is much larger and is on the 85% weight scale for her size?? (50-60% is what they call normal). And what do I do to get her back on track for her weight?  I haven't been eating SUPER healthy but its not like I've been heavy on sweets either.... help!!
title: Baby size.. help??
